mobs.long_desc: Stryker &7&b(&0&6Human&7&b)&0&9&b(&0medium&9&b)&0 is standing here.
mobs.desc: Stryker is calm and collected, strong and has a slight smile at all times.

mobs.long_desc: Varin &7(&0&6Human&7&8) &9(&0medium&8&9)&0 is standing here.
mobs.desc: Varin is sleek and agile, complete with cunning eyes and a piercing look.

mobs.long_desc: Tsaeldin the ancient historian stands here, slowly walking around.
mobs.desc: An wisened old man with greyish white hair and a long, scruffy beard.  The ancient historian paces back and fourth, looking rather pensive about something as he moves slowly about.  Occasionally he stops just long enough to rub his chin or tap his cheek with his fore finger.  His plain brown robes have long since begun to tatter and look quite worn, with frayed edges and holes here and there.

mobs.keywords: incubus demon devastating handsome man leering hells-incubus brian-incubus
mobs.long_desc: A devastatingly handsome man is here, leering at you.
mobs.desc: A man with an impressive mane of golden-blond hair and wickedly gleaming black eyes is here, leering contemptuously.  His body could only be described as perfectly sculpted, with bronzed muscles rippling with power as he moves.  His face could send even the most cold-hearted of women into a passionate frenzy and, judging by the expression on his face, he knows it and is proud of it. Faintly visible on his forehead are a set of pointed horns.

mobs.long_desc: A stunning woman shrieks in delight!
mobs.desc: Voluptuous, gorgeous, sexy...  Such words do not begin to describe this woman. Long hair whips around her seductively, and her clothing seems to be more ornamental than functional.  Gleaming red eyes promise mystery and excitement to anyone foolish enough to look into them, but something about this woman is slightly off.  Perhaps it is her pointed teeth and long, flexible tongue. Perhaps it is the subtle aura of malice she projects.

mobs.long_desc: A grinning demon with long horns cracks his whip here.
mobs.desc: A very tall demon with fiery eyes grins contemptuously here, cackling in mad delight as he cracks his whip of fire at anything that gets near.  Long, wickedly sharp black horns add to his height.  His upper torso is a shiny red that bulges with muscle, but it fades into goatlike legs covered in black fur that end in cloven hooves.  A howling wind surrounds him, and when he grins his teeth are pointed and bloodstained.

mobs.keywords: yugoloth greater humanoid grey mottled eyes greater-yugoloth hells-yugoloth
mobs.long_desc: A humanoid with mottled grey skin and two huge eyes floats here.
mobs.desc: Its body is covered in a robe of deep blue lined with red, but the hands that come out of the sleeves are not even remotely human - seven fingers and two thumbs on each hand, with skin of mottled dark grey and bony ridges protruding at odd angles.  The head is even more inhuman, as it is elongated and lacks all featured except for two large, cruel yellow eyes with hypnotic swirling pupils. The malice in those eyes would be enough to stop anyone.

mobs.keywords: glabrezu giant four-armed demon stalking hells-glabrezu
mobs.long_desc: A giant, four-armed demon stalks back and forth here.
mobs.desc: A pitch black demon with four large arms and an extremely muscular body, the Glabrezu's eyes glint with intelligence and malice.  One pair of arms ends in claws, while the other ends in cruel, massive pincers.  Its beastial features include tristed horns and a mouth full of glinting fangs.  The Glabrezu is said to be a demon that tempts mortals with power in many forms - physical power, political power, even material wealth.

mobs.long_desc: A massive demon with tiny wings floats here.
mobs.desc: Half bear, half boar and all demon, the Nalfeshnee is grossly fat, yet floats despite its tiny wings.  Tusks and horns protrude at all angles from its head, but its body is furred and reminiscent of either a boar or a bear.  Giant, clawed hands glint with rings that seem totally out of place on such a huge, ugly creature.  A cruel expression on its almost-human face somehow makes it even worse...

mobs.keywords: balor demon huge winged snarling hells-balor
mobs.long_desc: A huge demon with giant bat wings snarls at you!
mobs.desc: An aura of dark power radiates from the form of the Balor.  Standing almost four times as tall as a human with dark red skin and bat wings capable of blowing down small trees with the force of their wind, the Balor is a truly frightening manifestation of the wrath of the Nine Hells.  Flames lick its skin, spontaneously lighting and dousing themselves.  This demon would be a formiddable foe to even the most powerful mortals.

mobs.keywords: Belial demon crown prince nine hells lord destruction hells-belial
mobs.long_desc: Belial, Crown Prince of the Nine Hells, is standing here.
mobs.desc: Human in form, the Demon Prince is at once unsettling and frightening.  Red, pupil-less eyes look down upon anything and everything as inferior.  Dressed in black silk, his movement is inhumanly graceful and his lithe form is far more powerful than one could guess just by looking.  From time to time, an observant person could see flashes of Belial's true form - wings, perhaps, a towering form, massive claws, scales and feathers over smooth skin...

mobs.long_desc: A dummy loader stands here, waiting to receive orders.
mobs.desc: It looks dumb, with its facial features not dissimilar to your own. If you didn't know better, you'd almost swear you were looking into a mirror.

mobs.keywords: Belial lord destruction lord-of-destruction belial-stage-two hells-belial
mobs.long_desc: Belial, Lord of Destruction, has manifested himself here.
mobs.desc: Far more massive than any creature save perhaps the largest dragons stands a figure straight out of a god's nightmare.  Wings of flame and shadow tentacles sprout from the back of a six-limbed body topped with a monstrous horned head. Spikes and claws protrude unnaturally from many angles, and his three-pronged tail drips with a searing acid.  Black and red feathers alternate with diamond scales reflecting light that further confuses the mind.

mobs.long_desc: A demented old man waves his arms about, muttering to himself.
mobs.desc: The elementalist paces about with his arms, hands and fingers waving about in the air as he mutters long forgotten arcane incantations.  His eyes are wide and glazed over, as if his lucidity had slipped by him long ago.  His flowing black robes are tattered and marred by scorch marks here and there.

mobs.long_desc: A foul red demon unfurls its wings and snarls at your approach.
mobs.desc: Spawned in the depths of the nine hells, this Greater Baatezu stands a commanding ten feet tall.  It has a long snout like that of a dragon and its maw is filled with sharp and jagged teeth.  Protruding from atop the Greater Baatezu are two black tusks that slope over its head.  The Greater Baatezu's muscles ripple and tighten as it returns a thunderous roar for your gaze.

mobs.long_desc: A burning effigy of a muscular man grins evilly at your approach.
mobs.desc: Though its lower half a vortex of reddish-white hot flame, its upper body is much that of a muscular male human with a demonic looking head.  Its arms are massive and robust with large hands and long, slender fingers that could almost wrap around a human skull.  It head has eight knobby horn-like protrusions, four on either side, running from the cheek upwards as flames billow about its entire body.  The fire elemental lord points at you and grins evilly.

mobs.long_desc: A knight stands quiescent here, apathetic to his surroundings.
mobs.desc: Covered by quarter-inch thick black plates, the heavily armored knight stands motionless much like that of a statue.  There are no visible gaps in its armaments save for its helm.  An eerie greenish light glows from underneath its visor.

mobs.long_desc: A divine being of wavering light hovers effortlessly nearby.
mobs.desc: Though surrounded by a bright heavenly light, you can easily make out the soft, angelic features of the archangel.  Her wings rest motionless as she hovers freely about while six tentacles of light, three on either side, flutter vertically as if resting on an ocean surface.  The archangel's eyes burn a briliant light-blue as she quizzically returns your gaze.

mobs.long_desc: A divine being hovers effortlessly nearby, shrouded in wavering light.
mobs.desc: You can easily make out the soft angelic features of the archangel, though he is shrouded in a bright heavenly light.  With his wings resting motionlessly, the archangel hovers about while six tentacles of light, three on either side, flutter vertically as if resting on a liquid surface.  His eyes burn a vibrant light-blue as the archangel quizzically returns your gaze.

mobs.long_desc: The Grim Reaper is standing here.
mobs.desc: A coarse black robe covers him from head to toe.  His face is hidden under the hood and leaves only a black empty void to be gazed upon.  His skeletal hands hold a scythe, and are the only part of him which can be seen.

objects.ground: A razor-sharp dagger with specks of blood on it lies here.

extras.text: This seems to be an extremely sharp weapon, with specks of blood...

objects.ground: A flask full of strange liquid sits here.

extras.text: A quaint little potion of goodness.

objects.ground: A shiny, silver pentagram hanging from a small cord has been dropped here.

extras.text: A shiny pentagram encircled by a wire thin piece of silver, it hangs loosely from a black leather cord.  The silver is rather tarnished and dull, but still makes an attractive emblem nonetheless.

objects.ground: A shiny silver circle lies here in the dirt.
A brilliant-white shirt with some odd lettering floats here.

extras.text: A pure cotton t-shirt with some arcane lettering on the front. The lettering reads: I died for pergus and all I got was this lousy t-shirt.

objects.ground: A small silver necklace which is partially missing lies here.

extras.text: This bit of necklace looks as though it is part of a broken amulet.  It is a small linking of silver circlets fixed to a portion of broken gold.

objects.ground: A large jewel belonging in a necklace lies abandoned here.

extras.text: This jewel is large and appears as though it would fit nicely into a necklace. There is a broken piece of gold still attached to the gem which would appear to connect to some of the gold holdings on the chain.

objects.short: a pair of shimmering black leggings
objects.ground: A pile of black plates lies discarded here.

extras.text: Constructed from thick metallic plates, they shimmer from black to a dark charcoal gray.  The plates themselves are very light and oddly warm to the touch.  If you didn't know better, you would almost say they glow with an blackened aura.

objects.ground: A splintered piece of a staff lies here.
A small polished pebble lies on the floor here.

extras.text: A small polished stone, it swirls of white and crimson with tiny flecks of onyx.  The stone is smooth and cold to the touch, rolling loosely about in your hand.

objects.ground: A long, slender icicle hangs off the side of the ledge here.

extras.text: A slender shaft of frozen water, it is about four feet in length and three inches in diameter.  The icicle stings your exposed flesh as you examine it, sticking to your slowly numbing hand instead of melting.  Being of such an infinitely cold nature, you're not even sure one could melt such an object.

objects.ground: Sprouted up nearby is a small dandelion.

extras.text: A delicate weed, it its fragile leaves fluttering loosely about as you examine it.  It looks like many of the other dandelion that have cropped up sporadically in patches here and there about the place.  Even as you gently hold the dandelion, the breeze nearly blows the leaves from its stem.

objects.ground: Lost here in the dirt is a green rubber ball.

extras.text: A small rubber ball of a deep greenish color, it is worn and chewed along various spots with bits of rubber missing where teeth and claw markings have marred the ball.  However, it appears to be quite resilient still, making for a good child's play toy or something to bounce around here and there.

objects.ground: A tiny, plastic snowglobe sits upon a ledge here.

extras.text: A plastic snowglobe, complete with miniature town, denizens, guardsmen and even a fountain square.  Its is an exact replicate of the Town of Mielikki except that its encapsulated by water and covered by a blanket ivory shavings to represent that of snow.

objects.ground: Dropped here, is a vibrant feathered stylus.

extras.text: Dropped here, is a vibrant feather with a sharp needle like point made of silver.  A bit tarnished with ink dried to the tip, this rare quill looks like it has written its fair share of tomes and manuals, perhaps even a secret note or three in its usefulness.

objects.ground: A old brass lamp has been left here to tarnish.

extras.text: Old and tarnished, the lamp is still quite the treasure.  From its ornately curving handle to its long spout, it looks rather simple yet a masterpiece. Perhaps with a little polish or a good rubbing it would once again look as new.

objects.ground: Sitting atop an altar is a long, scented, wooden stick.

extras.text: A long stick, perfumed to emit a delicious oder when burned, the incense is most commonly used in cermonial functions by priests of the various mythoi. This particular stick has a heavy musty yet floral scent.

objects.ground: A beautiful bluish orchid is growing in the garden here.

extras.text: The orchid is fully blossomed with rich, blue peddals that fade a stark white towards the tips.  Truely one of natures finer creations, it gives off a strong and alluring floral scent.

objects.ground: A glint from a small coin here, catches your attention.

extras.text: A rare find indeed, this coin is unline any other minted coin you have seen. Its edges and face are now worn smooth and there is a peculiar scratch marring on one side, as if to denote it from the other.

objects.ground: On a nearby shelf, is an old deck of cards.

extras.text: The paper wrapping of the package is ripped and worn here and there, however the cards inside are barely worn except for a few snubbed corners.  With the right amount of skill, one could put on quite an impressive show of cardshuffling or cunning gambling with these.

objects.ground: A small, wooden match has been accidentally dropped in the dirt here.

extras.text: What, you've never seen a match before?  You strike it across something and POOF!...  Through the power of combustion you have momentary fire.

objects.ground: Sitting in the corner is a a flat, metal disc.

extras.text: Metallic black, the disc has an eerie reflection to it.  It is just light enough to be thrown about, more than likely catching air and sailing a good distance before it would come to rest.  The scuff markings and cracking near the rim of the disc indicate that it has seen much such use in its time.

objects.ground: An official &1&bFieryCon&0 2002 t-shirt floats here.

extras.text: A loose-fitting, all cotton, stark white t-shirt with a small FieryCon logo over the right side and a large FieryCon logo covering the back.

objects.ground: A small note is lying here on the ground.

extras.text: Hello commander, I was wondering if you could let me borrow those boots for a little while, when I am done I will have them promptly returned. Templar Magistrate of Mielikki

objects.ground: Ripped straight from someone's eye socket, a bloody eye lies here.
A black bag lies discarded here, forgotten by the ages.

triggers.commands: set count %self.people[count]% if %count% > 3 set count 3 end while %count% > 0 eval victim %random.char% if %victim.vnum% != 2215 eval damage 20 + %random.15% eval which %random.2% switch %which% case 1 * Less damage for flying people if !(%victim.aff_flagged[fly]%) eval damage %damage% * 3 end wdamage %victim% %damage% slash wsend %victim% A sharp-edged iceberg suddenly comes rushing out of the water and into you! (&1&b%damdone%&0) wechoaround %victim% A twisted iceberg suddely rushes out of the water, striking %victim.name%! (&4&b%damdone%&0) break default * More damage for people with stoneskin if !(%victim.aff_flagged[stone]%) eval damage %damage% * 3 wdamage %victim% %damage% cold wsend %victim% Ice begins to form around your stony skin, dragging you downwards! (&1&b%damdone%&0) wechoaround %victim% Frost starts forming all over the skin of %victim.name%, freezing %victim.p% joints! (&4&b%damdone%&0) else eval damage %damage% * 2 wdamage %victim% %damage% cold wsend %victim% The dark waters around you begin to chill your bones. (&1&b%damdone%&0) wechoaround %victim% %victim.name% grows a little blue and begins to shiver. (&4&b%damdone%&0) end done end eval count %count% - 1 wait 3s done

You're not worthy! oforce %actor% remove sceptre oforce %actor% drop sceptre endif

triggers.name: Nezer_head_rip_1
triggers.commands: wait 5s * Let's see how many casters we have in the room. set casters 0 set victim %self.people% while %victim% if (%victim.vnum% == -1) && (%victim.level% < 100) if (%victim.class% /= Cleric || %victim.class% /= Priest || %victim.class% /= Druid || %victim.class% /= Diabolist || %victim.class% /= Sorcerer || %victim.class% /= Cryomancer || %victim.class% /= Pyromancer || %victim.class% /= Necromancer) eval casters %casters% + 1 endif endif set victim %victim.next_in_room% done * So if we have casters, pick one, we don't want the same * one or to have a set order, so lets pick a random caster. if (%casters% > 0) set gotyou 0 while %gotyou% == 0 set victim %random.char% if (%victim.class% /= Cleric || %victim.class% /= Priest || %victim.class% /= Druid || %victim.class% /= Diabolist || %victim.class% /= Sorcerer || %victim.class% /= Cryomancer || %victim.class% /= Pyromancer || %victim.class% /= Necromancer) eval gotyou %gotyou% + 1 endif done * Hello target, now you must die! set message 1 set keepgoing 1 while %keepgoing% == 1 if (%victim.room% == 2216) switch %message% case 1 wechoaround %victim% %victim.name%'s magic catches the attention of one of Nezer's heads. wsend %victim% One of Nezer's heads suddenly takes notice of you.' break case 2 wechoaround %victim% Nezer's head darts at %victim.name%, who only barely side steps the attack. wsend %victim% You just barely side step a bite by Nezer's head. Lucky you. break case 3 set damage %random.20% eval damage %damage% + 105 wechoaround %victim% Nezer's head darts at %victim.name% again, this time grabbing %victim.p% in his razor sharp teeth! (&4%damage%&0) wsend %victim% Nezer's head darts at you again, this time grabbing at you with it's shapr teeth, OUCH! (&1&b%damage%&0) wdamage %victim% %damage% break case 4 set damage %random.20% eval damage %damage% + 150 wechoaround %victim% Nezer's second head notices the first chewing on something. (&4%damage%&0) wsend %victim% Nezer's second head notices you as the first chomps down on you hard, OUCH! (&1&b%damage%&0) wdamage %victim% %damage% break case 5 wechoaround %victim% Nezer's second head bites onto the half of %victim.name% that was sticking out before RIPPING %victim.p% in half! (&4DEAD&0) wsend %victim% Nezer's second head bites onto the half of you that wasn't already being consumed before RIPPING you in half! You are DEAD! (&1&bDEAD&0) wdamage %victim% 10000 eval keepgoing %keepgoing% + 1 break default done else wecho Nezer looks around for something that is no longer there. eval keepgoing %keepgoing% + 1 endif wait 8s eval message %message% + 1 done endif

triggers.name: belial_quest_start
triggers.commands: * Set the quest in motion, prevent retriggering stages * until completion or reboot/crash/etc. if %belial_queue% m_run_room_trig 2242 else set belial_queue 1 global belial_queue m_run_room_trig 2241 endif

triggers.name: belial_pre_combat_banter
triggers.commands: * Belial's Pre Combat Banter set %belial_queue% 2 set victim %self.people% while %victim% if %victim.vnum% != 2219 if %victim.class% == Paladin if %victim.sex% == Female wait 1s wsend %victim% Belial slowly approaches, lifting your chin to meet his piercing gaze. wechoaround %victim% Belial slowly approaches %victim.name%, lifting her chin to his gaze. wait 5s wecho Belial says in common, 'A rare and beautiful thing...' wait 3s wecho Belial says in common, 'Such a pity you should end here.' wsend %victim% Belial gently presses a finger to your lips. wechoaround %victim% Belial gently presses a finger to the lips of %victim.name%'. wait 5s wecho Belial says in common, 'I could offer you such pleasures beyond imagination.' wait 3s wsend %victim% Belial stares deeply into your eyes. wechoaround %victim% Belial stares deeply into the eyes of %victim.name% wecho Belial says in common, 'But that would not be enough, no.?' wait 5s wecho Belial says in common, 'No... your soul is too puerile to understand such!' wait 3s wsend %victim% Belial casts your head away from his sudden, baleful sneer. wechoaround %victim% Belial balefully sneers at %victim.name%, casting her head aside. wecho Belial says in common, 'Instead you shall all die by my hand!' wait 1s wforce belial kill %victim.name% halt elseif %victim.sex% == Male wait 1s wsend %victim% Belial slowly paces about you, sizing up your mettle. wechoaround %victim% slowly paces about %victim.name%, sizing him up. wait 5s wecho Belial says in common, 'Such pious arrogance...' wait 3s wecho Belial says in common, 'Fitting that you should end here.' wecho Belial pauses for a moment, pressing his finger to his lips. wait 5s wecho Belial breaths in heavily, raising his hands skyward. wecho Belial says in common, 'Do you hear them... do you hear their screams?' wait 5s wecho Belial says in common, 'They sing to me...' wait 3s wsend %victim% Belial snaps around, sneering at you with loathing and contempt. wechoaround %victim% Belial snaps around, sneering at %victim.name% with loathing and contempt. wait 5s wecho Belial says in common, 'And now I shall add your screams to the concerto!' wait 1s wforce belial kill %victim.name% halt endif else wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'How charming, someone come to throw themselves on my blade!' wait 3s wecho Belial says in common, 'Agents of a lesser perhaps... hmmm?' wecho Belial says in common, 'Come to usurp my throne, yes?' wait 5s wecho Belial paces about observingly, one hand clenched around a blood-red ranseur. wait 3s wecho Belial says in common, 'What's the matter, hellcat got your tongue?' wait 3s wecho Belial says in common, 'Don't be fooled, I see you trembling with fear...' wecho Belial says in common, 'I can smell it on you like a rotting, fetid wound!' wait 5s wecho Belial's eyes flair black as coal as he spins the blood-red ranseur about. wait 3s wecho Belial says in common, 'No matter, for your life ends here!' wecho Belial growls, 'Have at thee!' wait 1s wforce belial kill %victim.name% halt endif endif set victim %victim.next_in_room% done

triggers.name: belial_return_banter
triggers.commands: * Belial's Return Banter set banter %random.6 set victim %random.char% switch %banter% case 1 wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'Once more must we play this game?' wecho Belial says in common, 'By now, you know you can't defeat a crowned Prince of the Nines.' break case 2 wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'How I tired of this foolishness...' wecho Belial says in common, 'You are but a gnat to be squished forthwith.' break case 3 wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'It will be pleasure to show you unimaginable pain once more! break case 4 wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'Your death will be as meaningless as your pathetic life!' break case 5 wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'I grow weary of your intrusions...' wecho Belial says in common, 'This time I shaill see you stay dead!' break case 6 wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'The Nine Hells take thee...' wecho Belial says in common, 'For your soul now belongs to me!' break default wait 2s wecho Belial says in common, 'Your life ends here!' break done wforce belial kill %victim.name%

triggers.name: belial_spawn_demon_belial
triggers.commands: * Spawn Demon Belial on 5% HP set %belial_queue% 3 set victim %random.char% mload mob 2221 mecho Belial falls to one knee, his chest heaving in exhaustion from battle. wait 3s mecho Belial says in common, 'Fools!  You have yet to witness the true power of the Nines!' mecho Belial contorts momentarily as wings and shadow tentacles sprout from his back. wait 3s mecho Belial slowly rises up, his demonic form dwarfing you in size. mecho Belial throws back his head and roars with ferocity, causing your soul to quake. wait 1s force destruction kill %victim.name% mpurge %self%

triggers.name: heartbeat
triggers.commands: wait 2s osend %actor.name% as you grab the heart, you notice it starts to beat in your hand. oechoaround %actor.name% %actor.name% grabs a ruby heart, which starts beating within his hand!

triggers.name: cats_eyes_wear
triggers.commands: wait 1s osend %actor.name% As you lift the cat's eyes towards your own, they are absorbed into your eye sockets. oechoaround %actor.name% %actor.name% lifts a pair of green eyes to his own, and they are absorbed into %actor.p% own. return 1

rooms.name: Quest Stuff Zone, nothing Else
rooms.description: OH GOD, WHY ARE YOU HERE!!  YOU WILL DIE!!!!!

rooms.name: A Ruined Basement
rooms.description: This hole in the ground used to be a finished basement, but now it's just a ruins like the rest of the house above it.  There are no furnishings or other adornments, but the rubble is piled up everywhere, covered in dust.  The tiles that used to line the room are missing, cracked, and piled up in sorry heaps.

rooms.name: Torture Room
rooms.description: Hidden amongst the depths that are the Nine Hells.  This room is adorned with dozens of different varieties of torture instruments.  Pools of blood surround the instruments, covering most ofthe floor.  A large sign hangs in the far side of the room, perhaps it is important.

extras.text: Be good and ye might just be released, be proud and ye shall certainly be further punished.

rooms.name: A Blood River in the Wastes
rooms.description: A broken, rusty red land stretches out as far as the eyes can see, littered with chunks of smoldering rocks, broken weapons, and bones.  Everywhere rush torrents of blood, giving the plain a sickly-sweet tang to the air.  The sky has no sun, but is covered in orange clouds and seems to be backlit by an even glow permeating the atmosphere evenly.  The rushing sound of the blood rivers obscures most other sounds, but the ear is tricked into hearing screams and moans and the clashes of battle even while there are no visible creatures.

extras.text: Torrents of red flow in every direction, covering the already reddish land with an even brighter crimson shade.  The smell rising from it is a familiar one - blood.  Legend has it that the blood spilled in every battle makes its way here, though where it goes from here no one knows for certain.

Wherever the blood river does not rush, the dry land is filled with broken chunks of rocks, steaming with evaporating blood.  Shards of shattered weapons stick out at odd angles, some rusted into nearly nothingness and many others looking as sharp as the day they were forged.  Splintered bones litter the ground as well, making walking rather dangerous.

rooms.name: A Tower of Burning Iron
rooms.description: Walls of iron glowing red-hot surround you on all sides.  However, the furnishings of this room seem to be unaffected by the heat that comes radiating from all sides.  The floor is covered with a sumptuous carpet which, luckily, blocks the worst of the heat.  Stained glass windows and fanciful paintings cover the walls, and a huge chandelier hangs from the ceiling.  It has no candles, but glows instead with a pale blue magical light.  Plush couches draped with red silk adorn the room as well.  There do not appear to be any exits.

extras.text: The paintings depict beautiful figures engaged in acts of carnal lust.
Crystals take the pale blue glow and refract it into thousands of tiny beams of light, casting a mottled luminescence over the room.  Ordinary candles would no doubt melt in the room's heat.
Dark shards of glass are illuminated into figures of demons battling angels while mortals, tiny creatures in the background, quake in terror of the unknown.

rooms.name: An Acid Swamp
rooms.description: A fetid mire stretches out in all directions, though you seem to have landed on a mushy hillock instead of in the water.  This is probably a good thing, as the plants seem to be slowly dissolving even as they grow.  The stench of decay is mixed with another smell, one which turns the stomach though it is hard to place.  Visible creatures include giant insects covered in blood, imps, mephits, and lemures.  However, all of them keep a healthy distance from invading mortals.

extras.text: Looking like nothing so much as the tortured souls of twisted trees, massive plants seem to shriek in agony, dissolving even as they grow.  Smaller, parasitic plants grow on the trees and periodically release spores, giving the entire area a thick miasma that makes it impossible to see the sky.

rooms.name: The Field of Fire
rooms.description: Roaring fires belch up in all directions.  The ground is made of hardened lava, or perhaps it is only rocks melted by the constant, sporadic flames.  In the distance is a lake of lava giving out waves of heat, obscuring vision. Chained figures march around, whipped by vicious fiends, looking terrified that they will step into a flame.  Despite the fires, plants with sharp leaves thrive on the bare rock and slice open the feet of the unwary.

extras.text: Broken leaves of the plant reveal a sticky goo on the inside, which probably helps it survive the flames.  However, breaking a leaf to get at the goo is tough - a leathery skin covered in barbs protects the plant.
The chained figures seem to be of many races: humans, dwarves, elves, even orcs and trolls.  None of them look happy.

rooms.name: A Sea of Dark Ice
rooms.description: In all directions spreads a dark ocean.  The sky is black and starless, with the only light being a sickly green glow coming from the enormous mountains of ice that float on the sea.  Rather than naturally formed, these icebergs are probably magical in nature - twisted features scream silently in their depths, forever trapped by the wrath of the Lords of Hell.

extras.text: From tiny chunks of ice encasing evil-looking animals to huge mountains that could contain entire nations, the ice of the dark sea glows a faint green. Some icebergs are stuck together with many figures inside, while others contain only single creatures.  All have features locked into expressions of terror.
Impossible to tell how far up it extends, the velvet sky seems at once close and impossibly far away.  The only perspective is provided by the icebergs.

rooms.name: A Diseased Battlefield
rooms.description: Grey soil soaked with blood stretches out at a steep angle here.  In the distance are many armies, each trying to gain higher ground than the others. The crashing sound of avalanches is but a distant rumble beneath the much louder clamor of steel and iron clashing as the armies vie for the upper hand. Decaying corpses litter the ground, and broken weapons abound beneath the scurrying of otherworldly scavengers.  Flies buzz in giant swarms that occastionally block out the harsh glare from above, though no sun is visible. Though there is constant fighting, the purpose seems unknown.

extras.text: Many corpses look bloated from the heat and have turned a sickly yellow-green.  Weapons are rusted or, in some cases, coated with a nasty goo that looks quite poisonous.  The swarm of flies feasts upon dead and living alike, undoubtedly spreading nasty diseases with every bite.  All in all, this place seems like an extremely dangerous place to hold a battle.

Each army seems to be composed solely of one type of creature: goblins, drow, harpies, hellhounds and the like.  No single army has a definate advantage, since the terrain is constantly shifting and a good position one moment may be completely undone with a surprise avalanche.  Demons float over the armies, overseeing the battles and occasionally descending and whipping a certain army to a certain goal.

rooms.name: Demonic Arena
rooms.description: Dark black sand, pools of blood and bits of flesh make up what could be called terrain in this massive arena of darkness. The walls are made of ancient stone made into arches that support the grand stands that sit upon them. Glowing red eyes gleam out towards the arena from iron gateways that appear within each archway. Loud chanting is deafening as demonic forms scream for death from the grand stands that surround the entire arena. A gigantic throne sits to the north end of the arena, empty save for flashes of lightning that seem to hover in mid-air immediately above its great seat.

extras.text: Demonic forms clutter the great stands of this arena. Different forms from large ogres to smaller goblins all chanting for death. All chanting toward the great throne toward the north, chanting for Ac....

Ancient stones abound these great walls. Dark red in color or just tainted from all the blood that has splattered on them over the ages, they stand with great presence and dominate the surroundings. Each stone seems to have demonic etchings carved into it, unique from the others but pulsating with great power.

A massive stone throne, outlined with polished charcoal black marble, stands erect at the northern edge of the arena. It's large glowing emblem showing it's relative vacancy. Although it seems empty a mighty presence still manages to make itself known as bright flashes of lightning periodically reveal the outline of a giganic being.
Two half crescents, one pointing to the sky and the other pointing toward the ground, overlap each other every so slightly as they are intersected vertically by a large lightning bolt.

rooms.name: The Crimson Vault
rooms.description: Beaten copper, delicate threads of red gold, radiantly shining rubies, deep mahogany and every other imaginable precious thing red in color line the walls of this room.  No exits are visible, but a large mirror with a frame lined in scarlet silk shows a constantly shifting landscape: now fire, now plains, now a sea.  Utterly silent except for a sound of heavy breathing, the apparent peacefulness of this vault is unnerving after the constant conflict elsewhere in the Hells.  Though earthly riches abound here, what use are they if there is no escape?

extras.text: A long oval mirror set horizontal rather than the customary alignment of vertical flashes continuously with images of this plane and others.  Cities past and present vie with images of volcanoes, whirlpools, tornadoes and other places of heavy activity, be it mortal or natural in nature.  The frame is a work of art in itself: the scarlet silk that edges the mirror is embroidered with golden runes of magic and slender outlines of fantastical creatures doing battle.  Its value alone would be worth the price of a soul.

rooms.name: The Rift Citadel
rooms.description: Here in the top room of a massive citadel, far larger than any earthly structure, the walls are made of dull ebon and lustrous obsidian alternating in ways that hurt the mind.  Arched windows overlook a sickly swirling rift in the fabric of space-time that surrounds the citadel which insistently draws the eyes away from the other features in the room.  Almost by an act of will, the windows can be ignored and the rest of the room observed.  Lavishly decorated with priceless items beautiful and terrible ranging from sculptures to weapons to paintings, the center of the room is taken up by a large desk forged from the souls of the damned facing the Rift in the center of a giant pentagram inscribed in blood.  This is surely one of the prime centers of power in Hell. There are no visible exits.

extras.text: Windows arched into gothic points appear on all sides of the circular room, though an especially large one rises to the north.  Flashing with colors that change almost too quickly for the mind to comprehend, scenery which may be real and may just be a trick of the eyes, and warped textures that make it impossible to tell the distance between here and there, the Rift is massive in both size and power.  Someone who could control it would have access to any plane they wished, at any time in its history.  In other words, it would take a true planewalker to go any nearer without having their minds and bodies torn asunder, but the reward would be beyond imagining.

In the dead center of the room facing the largest window is a massive desk made of the swirling grey-black mass that is the physical appearance of forged souls.  The pentagram it sits in the exact center of is arranged so that on point faces west, one south, one east and two north.  The pentagram is formed by a shallow trough in the floor that is filled with constantly moving, steaming hot blood.  The chair set at the desk is almost a throne; and why should it not be, as this is the seat of power of Crown Prince Belial himself?

rooms.name: Amid the Nine Hells
rooms.description: You have entered a looming hall that stretches about five hundred feet, with vaulted ceiling and elaborate pillars running then length.  The smooth marble used in its construct absorbs nearly all light, casting a soft, almost ethereal, reflection of all things nearby.  Grand architectural carvings border the top of each wall with runic inscriptions found etched center wall at metered intervals, centered on brightly burning sconces.

rooms.name: The Reaper's Lair
rooms.description: The smell of death permeates the stale air of this filthy looking room. Countless skulls from the Reaper's past victims line the walls and litter the floor.  Candles of various sizes illuminate the rather large room, casting eerie flickering shadows that seem to have lives of their own.  The only noise that can be heard is the steady sound of dripping water echoing across the room from an unseen source.
